sentences.en: It has now become clear how extraordinarily fecund a decade was the 1890s.
sentences.cn: 现在已经很清楚19世纪90年代是多么超乎寻常、成就斐然的10年了。

sentences.en: The large, redbrick vicarage was built in the days of more fecund clergy.
sentences.cn: 那幢牧师住的红砖大屋是个多子女的牧师在职时修建的.

sentences.en: The pampas are still among the most fecund lands in the world.
sentences.cn: 南美大草原仍然是世界上最肥沃的土地之一。

sentences.en: The requirement contains a lot of humus, loose and fecund, the soil with good drainage.
sentences.cn: 要求富含腐殖质, 疏松肥沃, 排水良好的土壤.

sentences.en: With fecund and loose with the arenaceous qualitative soil with good drainage had better.
sentences.cn: 以肥沃疏松和排水良好的砂质土壤为好.

words.tran_cn: 肥沃的；多产的；丰饶的；生殖力旺盛的

trans.tran_cn: 多产的，生殖力旺盛的， 富饶的， 肥沃的
trans.tran_en: able to produce many children, young animals, or crops
